result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Zoom Instructions

Phone call from Deb/Kewanuee County, Jordan/DA's office, Atty Zuidmulder rescheduled the STC by zoom that was set on 11/18/2022 at 1:30pm to STC/SC by Zoom on 11/9/2022 at 2pm. Deb will send Zoom instructions.
Per Deb in Kewaunee County - Atty Kate Zuidmulder has agreed to take the case as a Dean appointment.

10:29 AM Defendant Joey J. Vandewettering in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Wisnicky was assigned as Judge Judge recused himself.  A JT was scheduled and had been removed due to no District Attorney.  Deft. still wants SPD to appoint.  The Governor appointed a DA who will start beginning November.  Atty. Luetscher recites status of counsel and that SPD has not been successful and suggest a court appointed attorney.  Court advises Deft. of option of Court Appointed Attorney.  Stmt. by Deft.  Court will appoint attorney to review case with Deft.  Court to look for Counsel for Defense.  Atty. Luetscher makes Stmt. as to Discovery that was given to Deft., and will make arrangements so that Deft. can listen to recordings.  Judge Wisnicky's JA to schedule Bond Motion by Zoom prior to STC.  Judge requests that Deft. file written Bond Motion.

11:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joey J. Vandewettering in court, in custody. Court rec'd letter from SPD as to contacts and are still searching for SPD.  Deft. wants to proceed w/o counsel as previously approved until counsel is appointed.  Deft. wants to represent himself at a jury trial.  Court advises he would appoint dean counsel but would take a lien on his vehicles.  Deft. advised he does not have access to vehicles at this time.

02:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joey J. Vandewettering in court, in custody. Deft. advises court he is trying to retain counsel on his own  and/or SPD.  Until then he wants to act as his own counsel.  Court reviews waiver of counsel and finds Deft. freely & voluntarily waives his right to counsel at this time. Court finds Deft. can represent himself until he retains his own counsel.  Deft. has not rec'd Discovery.  Court orders that the State to provide the Discovery now that he waived his right to counsel.
